triples.name: Hypergraph
triples.relevance: Hypergraphs are the primary mathematical structure being mined and analyzed in this survey.

triples.name: Network science
triples.relevance: Network science provides the theoretical foundation for studying hypergraphs as higher-order networks.

triples.name: Collaborative network
triples.relevance: Collaboration networks are used as a primary real-world application example for hypergraph mining.

triples.name: Graph theory
triples.relevance: Graph theory provides the mathematical foundation for understanding hypergraph structures and properties.

triples.name: Triadic closure
triples.relevance: Triadic closure is central to understanding structural patterns and open/closed triangles in hypergraph mining.

triples.name: Clustering coefficient
triples.relevance: Clustering coefficient is a structural quantity used to measure and analyze patterns in hypergraphs.

triples.name: Network motif
triples.relevance: Network motifs are recurring patterns of structural elements that hypergraph mining seeks to discover.

triples.name: Null model
triples.relevance: Null models are key tools used to test the statistical significance of observed hypergraph patterns.
